definition: To fasten or secure an object by driving a small, pointed metal object into it, typically using a hammer or similar tool. This action is commonly performed on wooden surfaces or materials, often to join or attach different components together.

examples.german: Ich werde das Bild an die Wand nageln.
examples.english: I will nail the picture to the wall.

examples.german: Der Schuh hat sich in den Teppich genagelt.
examples.english: The shoe got nailed into the carpet.

examples.german: Er hat den Nagel in das Holz genagelt.
examples.english: He hammered the nail into the wood.

examples.german: Sie nagelte das Schild an die TÃ¼r.
examples.english: She nailed the sign to the door.

examples.german: Der Handwerker nagelte das Regal an die Wand.
examples.english: The handyman nailed the shelf to the wall.
